attributes.action: AWARD OF A POSTHUMOUS VICTORIA CROSS TO BLAIR"PADDY" MAYNE
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: As a founding member of the SAS, Lt Col Blair "Paddy" Mayne was one of the most decorated heroes of the Second World War, winning four Distinguished Service Orders, the Legion d'Honneur and the Croix de Guerre.His actions on April 9 1945, at Oldenburg, north-west Germany, earned him a recommendation for the VC, which was turned down in controversial circumstances.it was reported that George VI inquired why the VC had "so strangely eluded him".

rejection.details: Unfortunately we no longer deal with requests for posthumous awards.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
